casebody.data:
STATE of Missouri, Respondent,
v.
Timothy PORTELL III, Appellant. No. ED 105148 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION TWO. FILED: February 13, 2018 FOR APPELLANT: Christian E. Lehmberg, Woodrail Centre, 1000 West Nifong, Building 7, Suite 100, Columbia, MO 65203. For Respondent: JOSHUA D. HAWLEY, Karen L. Kramer, P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102. Before Lisa P. Page, P.J., Roy L. Richter, J., and Philip M. Hess, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM

Timothy Portell III ("Appellant") appeals from the trial court's judgment following a bench trial convicting him of assault in the second degree. Appellant was sentenced to seven years' imprisonment. We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal and find no error of law. No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.

The judgment is affirmed pursuant to Rule 30.25(b).
